results.content: There is a lot of deviation from the purpose mentioned in introductory video and the way the actual course is covered. There is hardly any reference to the benefits of the technologies. Also, there is no details about the approach in terms of examination AZ300/303.

results.content:
This is a poorly organized course. The instructor just want to kill time. e.g.
1) always wait when system is "running"
2) just go to Azure console and saying "we have A here; we have B here.." without any demo the use by examples
3) > 3 times the instructor caught error, he just skip it without correction in front of us
4) in devOps section, > 3 times shows how to crate a server instance
....
I missed the old time/course such as AWS or spark...

results.content: I have opted this course for gaining knowledge and footing into cloud based technologies.  This course I am interested in to support my knowledge on BI, DW and MDM and for future implementations on these lines.  Nevertheless, I have followed through all the lessons with patience.  The very disappointing side of it is the faculties.  The faculty or the trainer should have the tact of explaining with proper examples related to real time issues or contexts.  These kind of one way tutorials are monotonous and they create boredom in the interest of learners.   Although the topic is not directly related to my requirement initially mentioned in this feedback, i got to know just the components and elements of Azure Cloud Computing.
